JobFullDesc:
The database market is massive (the IDC estimates it to be $119B+ by 2025!) and MongoDB is at the head of its disruption. The MongoDB community is transforming industries and empowering developers to build amazing apps that people use every day. We are the leading modern data platform and the first database provider to IPO in over 20 years. Join our team and be at the forefront of innovation and creativity.
MongoDB seeks a full-stack software engineer to help level-up the Engineering Corps and grow its sales tools offerings by orders of magnitude. Central to MongoDB’s ability to provide the myriad of technical resources utilized daily by all company employees, the Engineering Corps’ responsibility is to realize and develop internal technical solutions to problems facing individual employees, teams, departments, and the company as a whole. The team consists of software generalists with a large breadth of expertise and experience. They are full-stack engineers in practice, database and sys admins when necessary, and experienced service providers with a track record of timely delivery and delighted customers.
Our ideal candidate

Has 1+ years of experience developing APIs (Python is highly preferred, but not required)
Has experience with React or Angular
Is familiar with source-control systems, preferably Git
Is comfortable developing in a Linux environment and familiar with Docker & CI/CD
Has excellent communication skills and a desire to experiment
Is collaborative, detail-oriented, and passionate about developing usable software

Bonus Round

Familiarity with Salesforce API Development

Position Expectations

Develop features and write tests for a suite of internal tools and services
Contribute to functional specifications and design
Regularly review application code
Work with the Sales Team and Sales Operations to understand how they do business and develop technical solutions to help them do so more efficiently and effectively
Have lots of fun doing all of the above things

Success Measures

In three months you will have made several small contributions to our codebase and documentation
In six months you will be a resident expert with one of our applications and make regular contributions
In one year you will be well on your way towards developing a major feature (or two!)

To drive the personal growth and business impact of our employees, we’re committed to developing a supportive and enriching culture for everyone. From employee affinity groups, to fertility assistance and a generous parental leave policy, we value our employees’ wellbeing and want to support them along every step of their professional and personal journeys. Learn more about what it’s like to work at MongoDB, and help us make an impact on the world!
MongoDB is committed to providing any necessary accommodations for individuals with disabilities within our application and interview process. To request an accommodation due to a disability, please inform your recruiter.
MongoDB is an equal opportunities employer.
